p: Consisting of Î²- d-glucose, linear carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC) is an essential, water-soluble cellulose derivative [ 47, 48], which is cost-efficient, non-allergenic, transparent, non-toxic, easy to process and possesses preferable film-forming qualities [ 48, 49, 50]. CMC is exceptionally susceptible to water vapor even though it displays sufficient capability to form adequate transparent films and is an effective inhibitor of oxygen and lipids [ 50].
